mprParametrization.Description: Fill element parameters with different strategies
mprParametrization.t13: The parent elements will be collected from the linked files. For example, for the InMass strategy, these are Masses, for the InSolid strategy, they are solid elements, etc. Elements will be collected according to the categories specified in the corresponding column of rules
mprParametrization.t14: Strategies that work with element geometry (such as InRoom, InSpace, InSolid, SolidTouch, etc.) are recommended to run on the active view! If you run in the entire document, the elements take geometry that does not take into account the connection with other elements, which can lead to incorrect results
mprParametrization.t19: Renumber according to the position in the table
mprParametrization.t26: Write an empty result, obtained by calculating the expression, to the target parameter. For string parameters it is an empty string, for numeric parameters it is 0
mprParametrization.t27: Take into account the case when comparing string values in conditions
mprParametrization.t28: Tolerance used when comparing numerical values in conditions
mprParametrization.t34: Unique identifier of the strategy (do not change it!):
mprParametrization.t41: SolidTouch: tolerance of the distance between faces, mm:
mprParametrization.t47: Sets the algorithm for finding solids entries for InRoom, InSpace, InMass, and InSolid strategies. The "Auxiliary Rays" algorithm works fast, but allows to determine if a solid belongs to only one parent solid. The "Boolean operations" algorithm works slow, but allows to determine if a solid belongs to more than one parent solid. See help for details
mprParametrization.t53: Add fields from the list of favorite fields
mprParametrization.t54: Add field to the list of favorite fields
mprParametrization.t55: Remove field from the list of favorite fields
mprParametrization.t56: The list of fields already contains a field with this key
mprParametrization.t59: In this window, you can define your own names for the functions used in the formula editor. Function names must not contain spaces and control characters (brackets, commas, dots, etc.). Case is not important
mprParametrization.t62: Enter a unique key for the new field
mprParametrization.t64: Remove the association of the target parameter with the global project parameter if there is an association
mprParametrization.t68: Update field value in all rules
mprParametrization.t71: Use the geometry of nested families if the family has no geometry
mprParametrization.t75: The decimal separator for numeric values is used when converting numeric values to string values during formula calculation. Such conversions are performed when obtaining values from numeric parameters, when calculating mathematical expressions, and when calculating functions that result in numbers
mprParametrization.t77: Change the background of the strategy in the list
mprParametrization.t78: Change the background of the first cell of the selected rules
mprParametrization.t80: Configuration: {0}. Total number of strategies: {1}. Total number of rules: {2}. Total time spent: {3}
mprParametrization.t84: Number of elements that have been changed
mprParametrization.t85: Number of elements that have been skipped
mprParametrization.t86: Number of elements that could not be changed
mprParametrization.t93: Select the result of expression processing to see a list of processed element IDs
mprParametrization.t95: If no filter is specified in the rule, a common strategy filter will be used
mprParametrization.t101: Select the source element in the model
mprParametrization.t103: The following settings are saved in the current configuration
mprParametrization.t108: When setting value to parameter - after setting each value to the parameter of each element, the changes in the document will be committed. In this case, in each subsequent formula expression you can use the values of the parameters changed in the previous formula expression. This option may require more time for processing.
mprParametrization.t109: When processing rule - committing changes in the document will be performed after all expressions of one rule are processed. In this case it is not possible to change and then reuse the same parameter within one rule, because the changed parameter value is not yet committed in the document.
mprParametrization.t110: When processing strategy - committing changes in the document will be performed after all strategy rules have been processed. In this case it is not possible to change and then reuse the same parameter in different rules of the same strategy, because the changed parameter value is not yet committed in the document.
mprParametrization.t111: Export the current configuration. Use XML to store and transfer data. It is recommended to use Excel only for quick editing and subsequent loading back in
mprParametrization.t112: Export the current strategy. Use XML to store and transfer data. It is recommended to use Excel only for quick editing and subsequent loading back in

mprParametrization.msg2: Strategy will be deleted permanently! Are you sure you want to continue?

mprParametrization.msg18: In a limited version of the plugin, you can create up to three strategies
mprParametrization.msg19: In a limited version of the plugin, you can create up to three rules

mprParametrization.msg29: The selected file is not a strategy storage file
mprParametrization.msg30: A category added in a later Revit version and not present in the current Revit version has been removed from the "{0}" strategy filter for the source element
mprParametrization.msg31: A category added in a later Revit version and not present in the current Revit version has been removed from the "{0}" strategy filter for the target element
mprParametrization.msg32: A category added in a later Revit version and not present in the current Revit version has been removed from the rule "{0}" filter of the "{1}" strategy for the source element
mprParametrization.msg33: A category added in a later Revit version and not present in the current Revit version has been removed from the rule "{0}" filter of the "{1}" strategy for the target element
mprParametrization.err1: Each expression in a formula must start with the target parameter "$[ParameterName]="
mprParametrization.err2: The number of opening round brackets must equal the number of closing ones
mprParametrization.err3: The number of opening curly brackets must equal the number of closing ones
mprParametrization.err5: Condition "{0}" must contain conditional comparison operators ({1})
mprParametrization.err6: Condition "{0}" must contain values before and after "{1}"
mprParametrization.err11: Function must contain numbers separated by a comma
mprParametrization.err12: "{0}" is an invalid rounding convention. It is allowed to use "z" for AwayFromZero, or "e" for ToEven
mprParametrization.err13: The number of fractional digits must be specified as an integer above 0 or as a fractional number from 0 to 1
mprParametrization.err14: The second argument must be a rounding convention ("z" for the AwayFromZero convention or "e" for the ToEven convention) or the number of fractional digits
mprParametrization.err15: Function must contain no more than three arguments
mprParametrization.err16: Function must contain two numeric arguments separated by a comma
mprParametrization.err17: Function must contain three comma-separated arguments: a condition, a value when the condition is met, and a value when the condition is not met
mprParametrization.err18: Function must contain at least two conditions separated by a comma
mprParametrization.err19: Function must contain two comma-separated arguments: the number to be checked and the range of numbers separated by two dots ".."
mprParametrization.err20: Argument "{0}" must contain two numbers separated by two dots ".."
mprParametrization.err21: Function must contain at least two arguments separated by semicolons
mprParametrization.err22: Argument "{0}" must contain a condition and a value, separated by a colon
mprParametrization.err23: Failed to convert value "{0}" to a number
mprParametrization.err25: Sheet "{0}" contains the wrong number of rows and columns
mprParametrization.err26: Column 4 of row 1 on the "{0}" sheet should contain a unique strategy identifier (Self, OnlyFamilies, Types, InHost, etc.)
mprParametrization.err34: Revit could not set a value in the parameter
mprParametrization.err35: unsupported reference value type of parameter
mprParametrization.err36: reference value "{0}" when set to "{1}" is not found
mprParametrization.err37: parameter "{0}" is not available for editing
mprParametrization.err38: parameter "{0}" has data type "Integer", but set value "{1}" is not an integer
mprParametrization.err39: the parent strategy does not allow using parameters of conditional source elements (@[Parameter])
mprParametrization.err40: failed to get the field from the value "{0}". The value must begin with a field key enclosed in angle brackets
mprParametrization.err41: the parameter "{0}" has no data type defined
mprParametrization.err42: the empty value obtained when calculating the formula is not written to the parameter, because the "Write empty" option is not enabled in the formula
mprParametrization.err43: type with the name "{0}" is not found in the list of allowable types of the element to be processed
mprParametrization.err45: Element identifier (ID) cannot be used as the target parameter
mprParametrization.err46: The second argument must be an integer greater than zero
mprParametrization.err48: The third argument must be a positive integer greater than zero
mprParametrization.err50: Function must contain two or three arguments
mprParametrization.err51: The field with the key "{0}" is already in the list of fields of the current formula
mprParametrization.err52: Parameter "{0}" is not a reference to another model element
mprParametrization.err53: The target parameter must not contain the character "|"
mprParametrization.err54: An expression must not contain parentheses that are not function boundaries. To add parentheses to an expression, they must be escaped – "\)" and "\("
mprParametrization.err55: Function must contain a pointer to a parameter (@[] or $[]) as an argument
mprParametrization.err56: The list contains fields with the same key!
mprParametrization.err57: A workset named "{0}" was not found
mprParametrization.err58: Function must not have any arguments
mprParametrization.err59: Function must contain three arguments: source value, value to search and value to replace
mprParametrization.err60: The unique strategy identifier "{0}" on sheet "{1}" does not match the current strategy identifier "{2}"
mprParametrization.err61: Function must contain the address of the cell, of the form "A1"
mprParametrization.err62: Data source Excel-file not specified or not found
mprParametrization.err63: Insulation type "{0}" is not found in the current project
mprParametrization.err64: The "ToRoom" and "FromRoom" key parameters may only be used when processing families in the "Doors", "Windows" categories
mprParametrization.err65: No source element matching the filtering conditions was found in the model
mprParametrization.err66: The data for assigning the result of an expression calculation is not defined
mprParametrization.err67: Each expression in the formula must begin with the target parameter "$[Parameter Name]=", or with the function of writing the join of results to the conditional source element "JOIN(@[Parameter Name],)=", or with the function of writing the sum of results to the conditional source element "SUM(@[Parameter Name])="
mprParametrization.err68: Failed to retrieve a number from the value "{0}"
mprParametrization.err69: Unable to write the result to a conditional source element from a linked file
mprParametrization.err70: Element is occupied by user "{0}" and is not available for modification
mprParametrization.err71: No source element matching the filtering conditions was found on the current view
mprParametrization.err72: Unable to write result to parameter of element from linked file
mprParametrization.err73: Function must contain at least two arguments: a condition and a pointer to the result column
mprParametrization.err74: The name of column {0} must be specified by a Latin letter or number
mprParametrization.sld1: Strategy processes elements without considering their relationships to other elements. At least one filter (by category or by parameter) must be filled
mprParametrization.sld2: Strategy processes instances of families without considering their relationships to other elements. It is acceptable not to use a filter by category or filter by parameter
mprParametrization.sld3: Strategy processes types. If the "Process picked elements" option is selected, then the types of the selected elements will be processed. If the "Process elements on current View" option is selected, then the types of elements on the current View will be processed. If the "Process elements in the document" option is selected then all types in the document are processed
mprParametrization.sld4: Strategy processes elements that have information about the Hosts. Such elements include: Rebar, Area Reinforcement, Path Reinforcement, Rebar Container, Openings, Stacked Walls, and Families (including elements of Curtain Walls)
mprParametrization.sld5: Strategy processes elements placed in groups. When creating formulas, keep in mind that the target parameter must be able to change across group instances
mprParametrization.sld6: Strategy processes elements located in Rooms
mprParametrization.sld7: Strategy processes elements located in Spaces
mprParametrization.sld8: Strategy processes elements that have Solid geometry and are located in Masses. Masses must have a Solid form
mprParametrization.sld9: Strategy processes elements that have Solid geometry and are located inside other elements that have Solid geometry
mprParametrization.ssd10: Processing elements that touch their solids
mprParametrization.sld10: Strategy processes elements that Solid geometry and have flat solid faces that touch each other
mprParametrization.sld11: Strategy processes elements that are room boundaries
mprParametrization.sld12: Strategy processes elements placed in Structure Connections (Plates, bolts, etc.). Filtering of sub-elements by parameters, as well as the list of parameters of sub-elements in the formula editor, are not provided. Numerical parameters are set without conversion to internal units
mprParametrization.sld13: Strategy processes families that are nested within the parent family
mprParametrization.sld14: Processing Pipe insulation elements and/or Duct insulation elements. It is acceptable not to use a parameter filter for insulation
mprParametrization.ssd15: Processing of rebars in the system
mprParametrization.sld15: Strategy processes rebars as part of reinforcement systems – Area reinforcement and Path reinforcement
mprParametrization.sld16: Strategy processes all materials of the current document regardless of the element selection option
mprParametrization.sld17: Strategy processes elements that are part of an MEP system (electrical system, piping system or duct system). Conditional source element is the element's parent system
mprParametrization.sld18: Strategy processes the components of the Curtain Wall (imposts and panels). Conditional source element is the wall
mprParametrization.ssd19: Processing of elements in relation to specified source elements
mprParametrization.sld19: Strategy processes elements with the possibility to use any specified element of the model as a source element
mprParametrization.sld20: Strategy processes Parts taking into account the source elements from which the Parts are created. If a part is created from several source elements, the first element will be considered the source element
mprParametrization.tp2: Insert parameter of target family instance
mprParametrization.d-abs: Returns the absolute value of the number
mprParametrization.d-round: Rounds a value to the nearest integer or to the specified number of fractional digits
mprParametrization.d-roundup: Returns the smallest integral value greater than or equal to the specified number
mprParametrization.d-rounddown: Returns the largest integral value less than or equal to the specified number
mprParametrization.d-sqrt: Returns the square root of a specified number
mprParametrization.d-pow: Returns a specified number raised to the specified power
mprParametrization.d-sin: Returns the sine of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-cos: Returns the cosine of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-tan: Returns the tangent of a specified angle
mprParametrization.d-asin: Returns the angle whose sine is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-acos: Returns the angle whose cosine is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-atan: Returns the angle whose tangent is the specified number
mprParametrization.d-log: Returns the logarithm of a specified number with a specified base
mprParametrization.d-ln: Returns the natural logarithm (with base e) of the specified number
mprParametrization.d-exp: Returns e multiplied by the specified power
mprParametrization.d-pi: Returns the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter
mprParametrization.d-if: Returns the first value <true> if the condition <c> is true. Returns the second value <false> if the condition <c> is not true
mprParametrization.d-and: Returns TRUE if all conditions <c> are true. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-or: Returns TRUE if at least one condition <c> is true. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-inrange: Returns TRUE if the number <x> is greater than or equal to <min> and less than or equal to <max>. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-has:
Returns TRUE if parameter

exists. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-firsttrue: Returns the first value of <v> whose <c> condition is true. If all conditions <c> are not true, returns last <v> value
mprParametrization.d-lstr: Returns the specified number of characters from the start of the string
mprParametrization.d-rstr: Returns the specified number of characters from the end of the string
mprParametrization.d-tmirrored: Returns TRUE if the target family is mirrored
mprParametrization.d-smirrored: Returns TRUE if the conditional source family is mirrored
mprParametrization.d-strindex: Returns an index counting from zero of the first occurrence of the substring in the string. Returns -1 if the substring is not found in the string
mprParametrization.d-valuestr: Returns the value of the parameter as a string with units
mprParametrization.d-eindex: Returns the index of the successful use of the current formula expression
mprParametrization.d-replace: Returns value in which all occurrences of the given string are replaced by another given string
mprParametrization.d-format: Converts a number to a string using the specified format
mprParametrization.d-cv: Returns the value from the specified cell of the strategy data source
mprParametrization.d-count: Returns the number of times the substring occurs in the string. If the substring is not found in the string, returns 0
mprParametrization.d-lstrindex: Returns an index counting from zero of the last occurrence of the substring in the string. Returns -1 if the substring is not found in the string
mprParametrization.d-not: Returns TRUE if the condition is false. Otherwise returns FALSE
mprParametrization.d-distinct: Returns the differing values of the list, ignoring the start and end spaces when comparing values
mprParametrization.d-cvif: Looks for the first row in the strategy data source (Excel file) where all conditions are met and returns the value from the specified column of that row
